solution_line_template: He orders {num_shirts} shirts at ${shirt_price} each for a total of {num_shirts}*{shirt_price} = $<<{num_shirts}*{shirt_price}={shirts_total_cost}>>{shirts_total_cost}
He orders {num_shorts} pair of shorts for ${shorts_price} each for a total of {num_shorts}*{shorts_price} = $<<{num_shorts}*{shorts_price}={shorts_total_cost}>>{shorts_total_cost}

He spends ${shirts_total_cost} on shirts, ${socks_price} on socks, ${shorts_total_cost} on shorts and ${swim_trunks_price} on a pair of swim trunks for a total of {shirts_total_cost}+{socks_price}+{shorts_total_cost}+{swim_trunks_price} = $<<{shirts_total_cost}+{socks_price}+{shorts_total_cost}+{swim_trunks_price}={subtotal_cost}>>{subtotal_cost}

His order is over ${shipping_threshold} so he will be charged {shipping_percent_text}% shipping on his ${subtotal_cost} order so he'll pay {shipping_rate_decimal}*{subtotal_cost} = ${shipping_cost} in shipping
His order is ${subtotal_cost} and he's paying ${shipping_cost} in shipping for a total bill of {subtotal_cost}+{shipping_cost} = $<<{subtotal_cost}+{shipping_cost}={total_bill}>>{total_bill}
